title: How to Make Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Stir the pumpkin, milk, and baking soda together in a mixing bowl using a wooden spoon.
Add the eggs, sugar, oil, and vanilla to the pumpkin mixture.
steps.description: Mix well with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are blended.

steps.headline: Sift together; the flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and orange zest in a separate bowl, using a sifter or sieve.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients.
Using a flat plastic spatula, fold in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Drop a large tsp of the batter onto the cookie sheet.
steps.description: Leave 1” of space around each cookie to allow the cookies to spread separately while in the oven.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 min.
Cool the cookies on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Lift the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks to finish the cooling process.
Serve.
steps.description: These go well with a cup of mulled cider or hot tea.

text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Stir the pumpkin, milk, and baking soda together in a mixing bowl using a wooden spoon.  Add the eggs, sugar, oil, and vanilla to the pumpkin mixture. Mix well with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are blended. Sift together; the flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and orange zest in a separate bowl, using a sifter or sieve.  Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Stir between each addition. Using a flat plastic spatula, fold in the chocolate chips and nuts (if using).  Drop a large tsp of the batter onto the cookie sheet. Leave 1” of space around each cookie to allow the cookies to spread separately while in the oven. Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 min.  Cool the cookies on the stovetop for 2 minutes.  Lift the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks to finish the cooling process.  Serve. These go well with a cup of mulled cider or hot tea.
